isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT AUXILIARY DRIVE GEAR ASSEMBLIES

step1.para: Remove the auxiliary drive gear assembly from the mainshaft and rear bearing bore ( Figure 404). Do not allow the mainshaft to move to the rear when removing the auxiliary drive gear.

figure.caption: Figure 403. Remove Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly From Mainshaft

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear as far as possible, meshing teeth of the gear with those of the reverse idler gears ( Figure 405).

figure.caption: Figure 404. Move Reverse Gear to Rear

step1.para: Align the external splines of the spacer with clutching teeth of the reverse gear and move the spacer forward on the mainshaft and into gear ( Figure 406).

figure.caption: Figure 405. Move Spacer Forward on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the hub of the reverse gear and move the reverse gear forward on the mainshaft and into the proper position in the case ( Figure 407).

figure.caption: Figure 406. Install Snap Ring in Hub of Reverse Gear

step1.para: Re-install the auxiliary drive gear assembly on the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 408). Use a flanged-end driver and maul to seat the bearing in the case bore.

figure.caption: Figure 407. Re-install Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly on Rear of Mainshaft

step1.para: Align the six bolt holes in the retainer with the tapped holes in the case and install the bolts ( Figure 409). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 Nm) and lockwire the bolts in groups of three.

figure.caption: Figure 408. Lockwire Bolts in Groups of 3

step1.para: Install the snap ring in groove at the end of the mainshaft ( Figure 410).

figure.caption: Figure 409. Install Snap Ring in Groove at End of Mainshaft
